Reviews.Title: “They really have changed things around”
Reviews.Author: Creatto
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to stay at this location and from the get-go, my experience was pretty possitive. I would start suggesting for people signing up for the Priority reward club, since you get a few perks just by signing in. F.E. i got to access my room much earlier that they would usually allow me to. I arrived at around 11 am, and I was given my room well in advance. I enjoyed that they were really frindly and acommodating, and in my books, this counts for a lot. The room was not spectacular, but it was renovated, and the services were quite functional. The furniture was nice, the beds super comfortable, the TV really nice, and the Internet services were free, fast and readily available. I was working a lot for most of my first afternoon, and I was able to remain connected and productive. The pool in this hotel is also great, my friends were quite pleased, and although the dressers were a bit chilly, it was a minor inconvenience. So, this hotel is great if you are using it as your sleep quarters while exploring Toronto. All the members of my party enjoyed the hotel tremendously and the location was unbeatable for the price. So I will give you a full pass!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Would Recommend”
Reviews.Author: BarbadosBum
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean, comfortable and in a great location in the heart of T.O. We bought off of hotwire and were pleasantly suprised. Definitely not your typical Holiday Inn. The rooms are nicely decorated, modern and look brand new. The bathrooms are very nice and everything was very clean. Staff was all great. Parking was $25 and good until the next day at 3pm which was nice. I would definitely recommend this hotel for anyone staying in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: GreatWhiteNorth2k
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and modern. Room was small but we knew that from the reviews going in. We had the single king room and the bed was very comfortable. I would suggest paying the extra 9$ to include breakfast for 2 in the restaurant. It was buffet but reasonable quality and selection, and all the staff were really smiley. We will definitely consider this hotel for our next visit to downtown Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: olivia r
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying in the Holiday Inn Downtown Toronto and it was great! I stayed here for two nights for my birthday and my friends and I loved it! The hotel staff were wonderful and very friendly and the housekeeping did an amazing job! Great location because it was close to everything which I really loved. I would defiantly return back!

Reviews.Title: “Clean Hotel with Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JoeStabb
Reviews.Content: This was my third time staying at this hotel and it is the hotel I will continue to stay at while visiting Toronto. I'm usually in Toronto every few months. The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful and the rooms are very clean. The best thing about this hotel is the location. It is a good priced hotel right in the middle of everything.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Staff”
Reviews.Author: lovintravelgal
Reviews.Content: The staff were EXCEPTIONAL! Every one that I came into contact with were super friendly, professional and helpful! Everyone from the front desk to housekeeping and even maintenance! They really went above and beyond to make sure I had an enjoyable stay. I travel alot and it was so nice to see how much they cared about their guests! I will stay at this hotel again with any future trips to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: FarewellFire
Reviews.Content: Great location in downtown Toronto. During my three day stay I never needed to use either public transportation or taxis and instead walked everywhere. Friendly staff. I never tried the breakfast buffÃ©t but rather opted to dine out in the area instead. Rooms are nice and clean, beds okay but ask for a room as far up as possible since the occasional police cruiser in pursuit passing outside the hotel will be heard. Relatively cheap and instead of taking a cab - use the airport bus that offer feeder busses that drops you off/picks you up close by to the Holiday Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Nice downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: CNY-Tripper
Reviews.Content: Convenient location and a good value for a downtown hotel. Driving in and out was easy but when my GPS took me to the front of the hotel I had to drive around the block trying to find a place to park and check in. Luckily, the parking garage was easy to find and connected to the hotel. Just remember to figure in the daily parking rate in your budget when booking your room. The hotel was modern and clean. The staff was very friendly and helpful. (There may be something in the air because I found most Canadians to be very friendly and helpful.) The room, with two double beds was very small, but well appointed. We enjoyed the indoor pool and walked to nearby restaurants. There is a subway station a half a block away. Don't expect to be able to find ESPN on TV. This is Canada. Lots of hockey, but hard to find a basketball game.

Reviews.Title: “fine, but HOT, not in a good way.”
Reviews.Author: msdoucet
Reviews.Content: We were only here for under 24 hours, but everything was smooth from the parking to check in/out, however our room on the 21st floor was 83 degrees when we arrived, and there was no cool air to be found through the ac/heat system. We were advised to open our window, or if that didn't work we could change rooms. Since we were there for an event, we didn't really have time to deal with changing rooms, so we opened the window and went out for the evening. It was in the high 70s when we came back late at night. I would recommend a lower floor in the winter since heat rises and the AC is shut down for the season. rooms and bathroom were small, but adequate for a quick stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitable”
Reviews.Author: Jenn5mith
Reviews.Content: Everyone here was so nice. The hotel was pleasant and nice looking, though not necessarily appointed with the highest quality (which is to be expected at such an affordable price point). Lots of nice "green" measures, though the motion controlled lights in the hallway could give one a headache. Nice pool, serviceable workout room, and a central location .

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms but clean and nice”
Reviews.Author: farm2099
Reviews.Content: The holiday Inn used to be the Days inn before. They recently renovated and did a lot of work inside the room and it shows.You can see that they have put a lot of effort in the decor , the furniture , the beddings even the pillows. Even the small bathroom is nice . The rooms are still very small but they have made a lot of effort to make them look nice that you can only smile when you see the work. It is very well located close to a subway station. I wold suggest staying on the higher floor because of the noise of the tramways on the street. There is a coffee shop next to the hotel which has very good coffee. There is lots of family restaurant around that area. I would recommend the hotel but keep in mind that the rooms are not big and you dont want to be more than 2 or you will step on each other.

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rabbit74
Reviews.Content: I stayed here while in town for a function on the weekend of Feb. 17th/2012. This is a nice clean hotel, in a good section of downtown. Upon check in, I was greeted by a nice front desk agent who I believe was named Steven. I actually spoke to him a few times during the weekend, and he was always very pleasant and helpful. I booked two rooms for 2 nights (919 and 920) and they were both spotlessly clean. The beds were comfortable, and the HVAC worked well. They had told me that they had just spent in the neighbourhood of $20 million on renovations, and it showed. The bathroom, although small, was very well appointed and very modern. The location was also great. It was just steps from the College subway stop, and there were many great restaurants within walking distance. Also, the new Lawblaws in Maple Leaf Gardens was right next door, so I was finally able to see what the fuss was about. (Beautiful grocery store by the way, but that's another story.) My only minor complaints about the hotel were the size of the rooms, and lack of feather pillows. The rooms are very small. Almost European small. If you plan on spending a lot of time in your room, this may not be the best option, but for the average tourist or business person who only plans to sleep there, they are fine. Also, I assume if you have more than one child with you, claustrophobia may set in. That being said, they were perfectly spotless and very comfortable for 2 people. As for the feather pillows, there are none. This particular Holiday Inn does not have them in the hotel at all, and your only option is foam. (Although they offer a 'soft' and 'hard' option.) My issue is that I have a bad neck, and foam pillows always give me a headache no matter the firmness. If you *must* have a feather pillow like myself, remember to bring your own. All in all it was a great stay, and I would go back... unless, as I said, you plan to spend a lot of time in the room. Otherwise it's one of the best options downtown Toronto at this price point. *I never ate in the resaurant so I have no review about that, however there's an awesome little coffee shop attached to the hotel (Privately run) that makes a great latte if you're not into the coffee hotels serve!

Reviews.Title: “would defenitly go again”
Reviews.Author: doudlie G
Reviews.Content: We went on february 3rd 2012 for 2 nights, room 2222 and really enjoyed our stay. The staff was very nice and we had a great and warm welcome. The room (king bed) was very clean, the shower was perfect (powerful and all in ceramic) . We apreciated that we had different pillows (soft, firm) so we could choose de one we like the best. The breakfast (buffet) was very complete and delicious. The Hotel is at a great location to go to a lot of great places around (good restaurants, shopping) by walk. Since we read bad comments about the parking, we stopped at the hotel before looking for it. A gentlemen gave us a sheet with explanations and proceidures for the parking (wich is behind the hotel) and everything went perfectly. We also apreciated the free wireless internet conection and the coffee maker. The only negative point was that we had a frig in our room (wich is a good thing!) but it freezed the food we had put in.

Reviews.Title: “So This Is Toronto!”
Reviews.Author: ryandvy
Reviews.Content: I always enjoy praising hotels and hostels in my reviews for location. This one has it on top of being a top notch quality hotel. Everything in downtown Toronto is within walking distance: the Rogers Centre, the CN Tower, the Hockey Hall of Fame, the Shoe Museum, Chinatown, etc. I spent three days in Toronto and our group never had to pay for transportation. On top of this hotel's location, the quality is just magnificent. It is very clean and has a fantastic pool outside of which is a sun deck which offers a very nice view of the immediate downtown area. The staff here were among the best a hotel could hope for. They provided maps, tips on attractions, and well detailed directions on top of being smiling, friendly, and courteous. This hotel would probably rank among the highest that I have stayed at. It is middle of the road in that it is not loaded with plush armchairs and crystal chandeliers but it is very attractive and a great place to stay at a reasonable price next time you're in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Not much better than the first time around..”
Reviews.Author: citygirl0827
Reviews.Content: A group of girls and myself came here for a "girls night out". This was the second time we came here because my friend got the room on hotwire for a great deal. One complaint that I had last time I came here was the heat in the rooms. It was WAY TOO HOT! The heat kept on going up and up no matter what I tried to do. What helped was that there were windows that did open which cooled the room down. What I dont understand is why does the heat continue to go up when the fan is off? I went to bed and the room was 75. I woke up and it was 89. Security is another issue here.. when we came back to the hotel at 3am, there was a big group of guys (about 6 of them) doing some sort of "business" deal on the front steps! Being 4 small, vulnerable girls, we were a bit nervous walking into the hotel. When I mentioned to security that the men outside were conducting some sort of shady business, he just laughed and brushed it off and said I was overreacting. As a customer to your hotel, my safety should never be at risk, or laughed at. Your own customers are afraid of coming into the hotel because you have hoodlums in front of the doors selling drugs and then we get laughed at? Not appreciated at all. Overall our stay was good for the deal that we got, however if it was up to me, I would not choose this hotel had I known which one it was. Beds were comfy but the heat was unbearable. Cant the hotel do something so that we can fix exactly what temperature our room should be rather than just having it go up and up and up? Waking up to a room at 89 is just ungodly. And or those who dont know, 89F is 31C.. really now?

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: Gecko17
Reviews.Content: Normally when we go to Toronto we stay with family, but since we found a good deal we decided to play tourist. We were pleasantly surprised by the quality at this Holiday Inn. The service was great - from the front desk (warm welcome at check in) to Tegan in the bar (extremely friendly and efficient,) to the serving staff at breakfast. The location is excellent at Carlton & Yonge, at the College subway stop and next door to Maple Leaf Gdns with the huge Loblaws grocery store and LCBO. Our rooms were on the top floor facing south and a fantastic view of the city. While the rooms were a trifle on the small side, it was really not a problem. We had a king bed, a bar fridge that was not filled with overpriced drinks and treats so we could fill it ourselves. \outside or two rooms there was a sitting area that was great for sitting at to have a drink. This could be a problem if there are noisy people using the area. The breakfast buffet was included in our room price and it was good

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad basic hotel except for one flaw.”
Reviews.Author: CCheltenham
Reviews.Content: The location is fantastic. It is very centrally located in the middle of downtown Toronto. Also the price was right too. The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. What you would expect from a Holiday Inn really. The rooms are very modern if a little small. So the one flaw (and for me this is a deal breaker) is that Housekeeping woke us up at 8:00 am on a Saturday!!! We had not asked for a wake up call, and when we asked what time it was (as we were dead asleep) the housekeeper said it was 11 and we had to check out. I was definitely not happy about that. Also someone had left a tampon dangling on the picture frame above the bed (it was so weird we took a picture of it.) Housekeeping should have definitely caught that one. Otherwise the room was very clean, but come on. Outside of the housekeeping issues, a great hotel but a couple of glaring issues.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: brian k
Reviews.Content: I stayed twice at this hotel,I am also an employee of the company at another location.From John at check in to Carolyn at check out,IHG brand standards were 100 percent.It makes me even more proud to be an employee,and a well treated guest..Other staff i encountered during my stay who had no idea i was a IHG employee also gave 100 percent..I was a guest here many years ago when this hotel was Days Inn,i am very impressed with the transformation

Reviews.Title: “nice clean place in downtown”
Reviews.Author: Dimitry O
Reviews.Content: The place is very decent place to stay if your main objective is to be centrally located and be able to spend most of your time seeing TO . The rooms are a littel bit on the smaller side. But my wife and I didn't mind. The place was had a modern touch

Reviews.Title: “Nice Update and Location”
Reviews.Author: Frank H
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel before when it was the Days Inn. WOW.. what a nice update and change. Rooms are small, but updated in a sleek, modern look. I liked the spacious shower. Hotel is centrally located and a new market has opened close by, which is great! I plan on staying here again this summer.

Reviews.Title: “Great location tiny room, too many corners cut ...”
Reviews.Author: travellingdoris
Reviews.Content: The location is terrific, I usually try to stay in this area when in town. We found the staff extremely friendly and helpful. The room was too small for 2 people. The design was too compact. Bathroom tiny. No shelf space for toiletries - the sink area had no room where you could put things. Good that there was a good working mini fridge. No closet space to hang long things if you set-up the suit case stand. And you had to set up the suitcase stand in closet because there is very limited other space. Likewise, no real space for shoes in closet. Long desk under window for setting up laptop. TV on same desk so again, limited space. Very little room between chair at desk and bed, so felt really squished trying to sit at it to do anything. Seriously, do the designers not actually try to use the space before the design is finalised?? A pet peeve: given the hotel had both a bar and restaurant - why give cheap plastic cups in the room? Please give us glass ware and for water and coffee. Given the hotel's statement about the environment, I seriously doubt all the plastic cups, paper cups and their wrappers is a good way to go. The one thing though, is we paid 89 + tax/night. Good price for down-town. But next time, I think I will pa the extra 10 bucks and find a room that I don't feel so squished in. The bed was the best part. Very comfortable. And I liked that the window opened.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: AlexBGibraltar
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during a recent business trip to Toronto and found it to be a good choice of hotel. Nice central location, good facilities & service was top notch also. The room was clean & spacious enough with a comfy bed. The only downside was the room faced the road outside and was a tad noisy at night, but since I'm used to living in a busy town area it didn't really bother me. I requested to have a late check out at the last minute which was handled without any issue at all. The staff where very helpful & polite with all my requests which makes a nice change.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: JohnAberdeen
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location, convenient for down and mid town, close to underground also. The refurbishment has been a massive success - sooooo much nicer than the old Days Inn which was looking a bit tired. Its clean, got good sized rooms, comfy bed, nice bathrooms and great shower. The staff are particularly helpful...check in was friendly, quick and efficient.....Concierge was always cheerful ....all-in-all a great place to stay...will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Not up to the usual Holiday Inns”
Reviews.Author: Western70
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in December for work. I was surprised at how small the rooms were - not what you normally see in a Canadian Hotel. My main complaint though was the fact there was no hot water for showers in the evening - I tried both nights I was there to have a shower - and there was no hot water. There was hot water in the sink but not the shower. In the morning there was hot water in the shower but not at night. Not sure if they run out of hot water or what the issue was. The showers are new in the renovated rooms and also have a strange set up and difficult to direct the water as you normally would. The hotel is about a block away from a new Loblaw's store which has a lot of prepared food if you just want to get some soup or a meal without going to a resturant. The room had a little frig so you could always get some food at Loblaw's and keep it for the day. The bed was comfortable and had a choice of firm and soft pillows.

Reviews.Title: “Very Satisfied !”
Reviews.Author: xxmike83xx
Reviews.Content: This was my first time at this Holiday Inn location. I stayed for one night Dec 9th-10 on the 21st floor. I had a 2 double bed room. It was a very cozy and nicely designed room. I liked the sliding doors for the washroom and closet/min fridge area. The beds were very comfortable. The Guest Service Agents at the counter were all friendly and professional and willing to help with anything. I booked through the company's family and friends rate online.

Reviews.Title: “Very Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: EastCan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Holiday Inn Toronto Downtown Centre from November 17-22. It was my first stay at this hotel, being a Holiday Inn. I stayed a few times when It was Days Inn. I booked my stay through hotwire. When I checked in, I was given one of the smaller, darker corner rooms. I approached Steven at front desk with my concern, considering I was staying for 5 days. Steven was very helpful and professional and ensured that my problem was resolved and my stay was a comfortable as possible. I like the rono's and upgrades completed since the previous hotel. Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place Right Downtown”
Reviews.Author: beboccucci
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend in November. The staff was very friendly, and the hotel was very quiet. The rooms are small, but well maintained. It seems to have very recently been renovated. Will definitely stay here again when I'm in Toronto. Only drawback was that when we got there Friday night the parking garage was full, and we had to park in a surface lot. In order to not get a ticket we had to get up at 6:30Am on Saturday to feed the meter. The Courtyard across the street by Younge did have valet parking, so it wouldn't be an issue there.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable base for downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: weepaddy
Reviews.Content: Not going to set the world on fire with basic facilities and small rooms, but it's clean, comfortable and ideally located for downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: SteveC1970
Reviews.Content: I always stay here when I'm in Toronto. The hotel went through a complete overhaul a year or two ago so everything is ultra-modern. The rooms are a bit on the small side -- think of European hotels -- but the rooms are quite comfortable and stylish. I get the king beds and they are very comfortable. Free wifi. I think there's a pool too, but I've never used it. Breakfast buffet is perfectly fine, although another option is to cross the street and go to the Golden Griddle for their weekend brunch buffet. (The hotel breakfast is probably healthier *grin*) Convenient location -- one-minute walk from College subway station, and Dundas Square is three blocks away, the hotel is right next to the gay village. Parking tip: If you need parking, instead of parking in the hotel's inconvenient, cramped garage for $25 a night, park in the garage that's just a couple metres west on the same side of Wood Street -- easier access and it's $10 for a 12-hour period, so $20 for 24-hours.

Reviews.Title: “Worth for the (discounted site) price”
Reviews.Author: HoguinAnnArbor
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location, amenities, cleaniess, and qaulities were worth to be a three-star hotel. However, remember that they charge $25 for car parking. With the hotwire price, it is good to be there. The room for me with two beds was small, but not to feel too much cramped. The faucet accidentally was found to be dripping, but they fixed it. High-speed internet was fortunately free.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: nzsuze
Reviews.Content: Staff were very helpful but renovation hasn't updated much, still rather tired. Beds were comfortable and room size was OK and it was clean enough.

Reviews.Title: “Fine Hotel Even with Tiny Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Kenny0654
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here twice in recent weeks. The first time, my heating unit stayed on all night and the room was unbearably warm in the morning -- and the air conditioning wouldn't work. I reported that as I checked out. Second time was much better. The rooms are very small. A king bed uses up most of the available floor space. This is not a hotel to cram in 4 to a room, nor to bring piles of luggage in with you! Bathrooms are also tiny, but well laid out to make best use of the space. Everything is very new, comfortable, neat and clean. The place obviously got a thorough makeover before becoming a Holiday Inn this year. The pool and health club on the 6th floor is shared with a neighbouring condo tower, but I never saw anyone else while I was in there. And the pool is a great size if you swim for exercise, about 15 metres at a rough guess. Main floor restaurant has a good breakfast buffet, or if you want a change of pace there is a Cora's restaurant -- the greatest breakfast chain in Canada -- right across the street. It's a 2 minute walk to the TTC subway at College station. Accessibility may be an issue, as it's necessary to climb some steps to the front door. I did not see any alternate handicapped access or entrance. Glitches aside, this hotel does deliver an excellent stay in a comfortable room at what is, for downtown Toronto, a reasonable rate.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms if you prefer no heat!”
Reviews.Author: Steve W
Reviews.Content: I have recently stayed at this hotel while on business. While most of the rooms have been done I do not think the carpet was replaced. Also, tonight I spent 45 minutes waiting for someone to come and look at the heat in the room since it was set for 72 and would not budge from 65. After my initial call I had to call back after 30 minutes to find out why no one had come to check out this issue. They were coming to show me how to adjust the heat ( I dont think I should leave my own house if I can not figure out how to adjust the heat). After 5 minutes of this gentleman playing with the thermostat I was informed that it did not work (I never would have figured this out by the cold air blowing and the thermostat set to 72). I was told that he would talk to the front desk about getting me a room that had heat. 20 minutes later someone brings me a space heater??????? Really, 20 million renovation and you can not find me a room that has heat. If I wanted to pay 150.00 to sleep in an icebox I would have stayed at a motel 6.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: Vic_Mackie
Reviews.Content: Decent room, clean, fair price. Absolutely freezing, although the engineer did come in and fix that for us after a while. Very slow to check in due to number of guests versus number of staff, and waited an eternity for the lift. Good location, very near underground station and within walking distance of a great restaurant (The Keg).

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in the Downtown Core”
Reviews.Author: gabster_7
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through one of those mystery hotel deals. When we found out it was the Holiday Inn we were a little worried since we thought it would be a cheap motel. The hotel must have been newly renovated because it is really nice and CLEAN! The rooms are a little small but they work fine. The washroom was also small but very nice and clean with nice counter tops. It has a very modern feel which is very nice. We had a good TV, closet, and mini fridge that works! (I've had bad experiences where there are no fridges). Also the staff was great! We were there for one night to celebrate a friends birthday, so we were going to have some people over. They told us that they would put us on the party floor so as to not disturb anyone else. The only downside I can think of is that there are only 4 elevators and lot's of floors. Overall I would definitely come back and would recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Greg T
Reviews.Content: Very enjoyabe stay, excellent location to the downtown. Thanks to Daniel for the excellent service and help. Good employees really do make a difference,

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: prnewman
Reviews.Content: Despite the small bathrooms, strangely shaped floor plans and elevator wait times this place was a great value. The location is just right and will save you lots of money when using public transit. It's two and a half (maybe?) blocks from the subway, right off the rail cars, and is super close to a grocery store so you can save money by not eating out every meal. Not a bad walk to Yonge St and other bars. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Exception Service”
Reviews.Author: MikeAlmasri
Reviews.Content: I was very apprehensive about staying at a Holiday Inn until I approached a very swanky and contemporary newly renovated lobby. But I'm not that superficial. What I really want to comment on is the exceptional service I received by the staff, in particular a front desk attendant, Tanya Adams. Our arrival came just as Tanya's shift had ended. As she was walking out of the hotel with her coat on, she turned around, noticing we needed to check our bags, and personally checked them for us as the bellman was preoccupied with other guests. Even after I insisted that I did not want to prolong her stay at work, she proceeded to assist us, an act that was far above and beyond the professional call of duty. This was rooted in genuine generosity, attributes which as of late seem lacking not only in the hospitality industry, but the world in general. As if that weren't reason enough to be pleased, the rest of our visit was accompanied by Tanya's vast knowledge of Toronto's hip and young nightllfe, diverse dining options and great suggestions for entertainment and shopping. Tanya is reason enough to revisit this particular hotel. Other highlights, nice and clean rooms. Mark the Bellman was also very helpful and friendly while another bellman even declined a tip after helping us with our bags. Overall, a great stay, thanks to the outstanding employees of the hotel, they really made the difference, in particular Tanya Adams.....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, very comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: Shirlsvk
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this property many times over the years previously when it was the "Days Inn". I was truly impressed with the renovations and upgrades to this hotel, now the Holiday Inn! From the time we arrived the staff were super helpful, we had arrived in Toronto by train quite a bit earlier than check in time. We asked at the front desk if there was somewhere we could leave our things as check in was not until 3, the very polite and courteous front desk clerk said she would check to see if there was a room ready, it was only 11am, we were not expecting to get into a room at this time! Well as luck would have it we were given a room with no extra charge for early check-in, so off we went up the elevator. When we opened the room door I was pleasantly surprised at the many changes that have been made to this hotel, the room albeit small, was very inviting, warm, hip and most of all clean! I especially liked the new bathrooms. As someone else mentioned, the room was a bit warmer than I am used to but no worries the window opens and the cold breeze was welcomed! The flat screen TV was a great to watch the hockey game, and the mini fridge was great to keep the beer cold.. overall the room was perfect! Upon check out we left our bags with the bell hop, no charge.. which was great not having to lug our bags around so that we could spend a few more hours shopping before we headed back home on the train. Overall, the staff, location and amenities at this hotel were just perfect! We will be back on our next shopping trip to the city! Tip...After a day of walking and shopping, try an irish cream latte at the coffee shop in the lobby, mmm yummy and won't set you back as much as the starbucks down the street!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: Ravs27
Reviews.Content: Was in the area for appointments at UHN and this hotel is in the perfect location and within walking distance. Parking was $20 in the garage next to the hotel with in/out privileges so that was great and there were lots of restaurants nearby as well. ROom was clean and comfortable and provides great amenities like fridge/microwave and LCD TV with PPV movies to keep the kids entertained. Will defintiely book here agian!

Reviews.Title: “Too much heat and poor service”
Reviews.Author: mark p
Reviews.Content: I am a priorty club member and always tend to stay at holiday inns hotels during my business travel. When in Toronto I usually stay at the Holiday Inn express on Lombard Street but this time decided to try the one on Carlton Street. Got into my room at 10pm and noticed the thermostat reading 80 degrees. Not thinking much of this, I turned the thermostat to 68 degrees to cool down the room and went to bed. I woke up at 1:30 am and noticed the room was still very warm. Checked the thermost and it read 79. I called the front desk and he stated the air conditioner was shut down and to open the window. I said this was not a very good resolution and was their another room. He said he would call me back. About a half hour later he called and said there was a room available and did i want to check it out. I opened the window and said I would stay where I was. The point is the temperature should have be set for a maximum of 72 at the highest and that the room was too hot. My best guess is other rooms were the same. When I went out in the morning the hallways were very hot and when I met others i overheard them mention how hot the rooms were too. Not what I am accustomed too at Holiday Inn hotels. Will stay at another hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay in central Toronto”
Reviews.Author: AndyAtl
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel for a quick 2-night business trip. The location is fantastic, just off Yonge Street with a TTC subway stop on the corner. The hotel's secured parking was priced in line with other options (about the same or less expensive than nearby municipal garages). Rooms are small, but this is typical for a downtown hotel. The room amenities were new and good, making the small room more comfortable than it might have been. If you must have a larger room, book a queen+queen room instead of a king room. I was traveling solo and had plenty of space for myself. Wi-fi access worked perfectly inside the room. The bathroom was excellent, featuring marble, a glass shower stall with a door that didn't leak, and a shower that could peel paint. And there was enough bathroom shelf/counter space that my wife and I could have both been happy, had she accompanied me. My room had a couple of issues -- most seriously, I realized on the second night that my deadbolt wasn't engaging because of some misalignment in the door frame. But the room keys are chip-enabled, which is a much newer and more secure keying technology; and I just didn't want to bother asking for a different room. The in-room safe made me more comfortable with my decision. Also the fancy iPod-docking alarm clock didn't work. I didn't ask for a repair, so the hotel didn't have a chance to respond to that issue. The elevators are a weakness at this hotel. They are big enough to accommodate 8-10 people apiece, and there are 4 elevators, but there seemed to be a long wait almost all the time. I think the management should reprogram the elevators so that two would service only the top 11-12 floors. It would speed up everyone's journey. But the perfect hotel doesn't exist, certainly not at the attractive price point of this hotel. I chose to eat breakfast outside of the hotel. I tried a 24-hour joint across the street (decent enough) the first morning. One block east on Carlton I found an even better option for the second morning (Daybreak) where the service was exceptional and the food was excellent. After returning home, I thought I might have left a pair of cufflinks in the hotel. I called and was promptly connected to the housekeeping department. The person who answered searched the lost and found items without success. Fortunately I later found the cufflinks inside a zippered compartment I rarely use. Nevertheless I thought the hotel staff did an excellent job trying to help me with the issue. Overall I had a great stay and would happily come back.

Reviews.Title: “Average, Slow Elevators”
Reviews.Author: alliesana
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two nights in a standard double room. Fortunately we stayed on the 4th floor, which meant stairs were an option and we didn't have to wait for the glacially-slow elevators to stop at our floor. The rates at this Holiday Inn fluctuated quite a bit - around $130 one night, and over $300 the next night. If you can get in the lower side, the hotel is clean and in a convenient downtown location. Otherwise, it is VERY overpriced for a 3-star room. The hotel was having issues with their HVAC system too, the result being that the first room offered was 82 degrees, with no way to cool it off. I'd stay here again if needed , but only if I couldn't find something better at a comparable price.

Reviews.Title: “way too hott!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: citygirl0827
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on October 29, 2011 with 4 of my other friends. We got two standard rooms with 2 double beds. The location of the hotel is central to everything, and right off of the Gay Village. At night though its not that great because just down the street (literally 2min walking distance) there are prostitutes on every corner. Its nice knowing that when I look out my window I can see a girls on the corners. When we checked in it was fast and the guy at the front desk was very nice. I booked the hotel online through hotwire on September 29 and the minute I did so, I called the hotel asking if we could get rooms side by side. They had reassured me that they put them together. When we got to the front desk the man said that there was no note stating that we be side by side. He did his best and we were only one room apart which was fine, however I didnt appreciate the fact that even though I called, I still didnt get what I asked for. No big deal though. When we went to our rooms it was small yes, but it was clean! A problem that we had was one of our lamps wouldnt work and our phone was not working! I called down to the front desk to ask if we could perhaps get someone to fix our phone. They said they would send someone right up but no one came! Again, no big deal. The rooms were cozy, not cold like your typical hotel room... until we noticed on the thermostat that it just kept on getting hotter and hotter! When we went to sleep (4am) the room was at 78. An hour later I woke up in sweats, only to see that the room was at 85! We set the thermostat to AC and set it for 72 but it still kept on getting hotter and hotter. We asked the housekeeping staff how to fix it and even they said that our room always has that problem (our room was 315). Thank god for the windows being able to open because that was the only way we cooled down the room. The next morning we had a scheduled check out at 11am, but I called down and asked for a later check out. Without any hesitation they extended it to 1pm which was fantastic. Checking out was no problem, however on my way home I realized I had forgotten my pillow in the hotel room. I called the hotel and they directed me to the housekeeping. They told me that they have it and that they will keep it until I come and get it. I ended up getting it, and they even gave me a free newspaper LOL I guess they had extras? Parking was easy to find because I know downtown Toronto really well. The hotel is located on Carlton St, and the parking lot is located on Wood St. If you look on a map, its not at all hard to find. There is a public parking lot right beside the hotel parking lot, but my fiance insisted that I used the hotel parking because its "safer". It was $25, which is standard. The parking is quite tight so be careful! Over all my stay was pleasant however it was way too hot and I could barely get any sleep. Nice hotel though, well kept and would definitely recommend it IF the heat was not an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: Rocker08
Reviews.Content: Hotels in downtown Toronto can be pricey so when I saw this one I decided to book it. I was pleasantly surprised! The stay was nice. I was there with a girlfriend and we had a nice big room with 2 beds. No complaints about hosekeeping. The staff at check in were friendly & helpful. Public transit close by and easy to get around all of downtown. All in all a good experience at the Holiday Inn. Who would have thought!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. Great Location. Great Value.”
Reviews.Author: MacDonald's
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel the past two nights. Room was small'ish, but everything was clean, new, and comfortable. Excellent location for walking or public transit.

Reviews.Title: “Decent but not great”
Reviews.Author: cndtraveler555
Reviews.Content: When we arrived the front desk staff was very pleasant and friendly. However when we got to our room we were very disappointed. The toilet was clogged, disgusting way to arrive to your hotel room. We were in a hurry to get showered and off to Jay's game....of course, the shower was broken too. We called the front desk and after waiting 30 minutes we had to leave for the game without showers, not the best way to start our trip. The room overall was very tiny but fine for two people. The location was great, close to the subway and tons of stuff to do. Overall I think the price is a little high for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty average 3-star”
Reviews.Author: surfsister_10
Reviews.Content: I left my booking too late and got stuck here for 3 nights on a business trip. The rate was ridiculously high for a 3-star hotel, but Toronto was completely booked up that week with several conferences, etc. Next time I will remember to book earlier so I can stay at a 4-star! The hotel was pleasant enough, the renovations they have done mean the rooms have modern furnishings and bathrooms, but they are TINY (hard to squeeze between the end of the bed and the dresser/tv); sure glad it was just me staying here. Elevator service was incredibly slow with long waits and crowded cars at all times, really annoying, and the maids seem to have skimmed over my room on the 2nd day as the trash was not emptied and the bed was hardly made. But the biggest complaint I had was the SLOW wireless internet. Great that they have free internet, terrible that it basically doesn't work (esp in the evenings between 6-10pm) when I needed to work and everyone else is obviously using it too. I had a cold shower on my 2nd morning (no hot water?!), which put me in a very bad mood as well. Also, the foam pillows were uncomfortable, the room was hot/dry at night, and the condo across the street looked straight into the rooms -- meaning your curtains had to be closed the whole time. The College subway station was a 2-min walk, so that was handy, and there was a coffee shop and a bar in the lobby that I didn't use along with movie theatres and several fast-food joints in the area - but it was a sketchy neighborhood, and given the issues I encountered, I would never stay here again - certainly not at the price I paid.

Reviews.Title: “Good downtown option”
Reviews.Author: Peter_TelAviv
Reviews.Content: I arrived to the property with some concerns, but I was proved (again) the a Holiday Inn is a Holiday Inn. Hotel has undergone an extensive renovation work recently, which you can immediately spot. In spite of this, rooms are on the small side (4 people will have serious trouble managing in such) but very clean, new & comfortable. Breakfast is definitely overpriced - there is a nice selection of hot & cold, but it's definitely not worth 18$ per person. Also, I had breakfast & parking included in my rate but they tried to charge my anyway - Always have a copy of your rate and what's included! Other than that, a good experience and a nice value hotel in downtown Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but avoid room 2323”
Reviews.Author: Frequent Traveller from Scotland
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at this property. I came back as the first experience was great. Second was pretty average, showing the difference that good staff make. I booked a deluxe room (which is a couple of categories above standard) and with my Platinum card was hoping they would give me one of their suites. I know these are subject to availability but this was a weekend and you'd suspect that these would not have all been sold. Seems there were lots of other people who had got the upgrades before me. But, that's the deal with the card and I was looking forward to my deluxe room. However, the guy at the front desk told me lots of people were checking out on the Saturday and there should be suites then. So I thought, it's late, I wont unpack and will check tomorrow. Well......I was disappointed with my top floor room. It was dark - even at night time and had the tiniest window going. The following morning, even with it being a nice sunny day, the room still needed the light on. The pigeon netting in front of the window was an additional touch you can look forward to. So, I asked at the front desk about moving as the room was dark. Surprisingly, no suites available. But the room they were offering (plus point for at least trying) was much smaller and not much brighter. So I opted to stay. Also on the plus side, great bed - although don't have two of you sit at the end of it as it will tip up! Shower was fantastic. Bathroom is nice but no place to put anything. For a deluxe room there were only plastic glasses. I know it is a Holiday Inn but you'd hope you'd have glass - especially in a deluxe room. Now for the bit that will really stick in my mind (and will stop me going back). At check out the lady "serving" me was way more interested in talking to another customer who turned up after me and was being served by the person next to her. No "did you enjoy your stay?", no "we appreciate your business". No eye contact. No smile. So, if you do visit, it will be ok, but don't expect any service from this particular lady at check in (unless you speak Mandarin/Cantonese in which case the service will be top notch.) And avoid any of the rooms in the corner of the hotel as they are probably all as dark as the one I was in.

Reviews.Title: “hot and noisy !!!”
Reviews.Author: guinnessfillier
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Holiday Inn on Carlton Street in Toronto was very disappointing. My room was extremely hot and when I tried to use the air conditioning to help cool it off I was told that it was a Toronto Bylaw that air conditioning was to be turned off !!!! Go figure. This isn't the first Hotel I have stayed in during the fall and winter season BUT it is the first time I was told I couldn't use the air conditioning. I phone the front desk and was offered another room. I went to the other room and met the gentleman who was working the front desk. The room was cooler simply because the windows were wide open which allowed all the noise of the busy street below to come in. There was pudding smeared into the carpet outside this room as well as trays which had not been picked up. For our inconvience we were offered free parking and 2 complementary breakfasts. Even though we were absolutely unsatisfied with our room and spent the night awake because of the noise we accepted the offer. Today I received a bill for parking and no one will speak to me. I am very unsatisfied and would suggest looking elsewhere if planning on staying downtown Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a business trip-Excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Misha514
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel october 14-16. The room was perfect for a small stay, and actually quite comfortable and was very clean. Price-wise its a great deal for a downtown Toronto hotel. The bathrooms was newly renovated and the water pressure is great in the stand-up shower. It is very well located with all amenities close by including great shopping and food. Far and beyond the actual quality of the hotel which is quite good- Is the incredible staff! From the bellhop, to the waiter at the restaurant, to even the supervisor who was checking the work of the cleaning staff- everyone asks how you are doing and if you need any help! It was such a pleasant experience to stay in a hotel where you actually feel welcomed and appreciated. I will definitely be staying at this hotel for all my trips to Toronto

Reviews.Title: “modern hotel, details missing”
Reviews.Author: Armindai
Reviews.Content: Newly renovated rooms, well equipped with iron and board, flat screen TV, windows can be opened about 3 inches wide. The indoor pool is nice, the showers lacking shampoo and towels. The offerend full breakfats at 16 CAD seems quite expensive, other facilities are close and more economic. Wake up calls did not come at the right time, either 1 hour early or 20 min too late. The heating system (AC) seems to have a severe problem, nearly all the rooms of our groupo were far too warm and could not be colled down.

Reviews.Title: “VERY BEAUTIFUL AND IN CENTRAL ZONE”
Reviews.Author: kreevsit
Reviews.Content: We're in this hotel in August .. central location very convenient to any place .. and clean, comfortable ...the wireless connection is great. The metro is a few hundred meters and can reach the most distant from the center within minutes. I recommend it for a stay in Toronto .. the managers of the Hotel Mr Yates and Mr Monnard ...really a very attentive to guests' needs.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and good location”
Reviews.Author: James M
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located 100 metres from a subway - easy to get to and from downtown. Staff were all extremely friendly and helpful. Hotel had all the useful amenities - internet, bar, coffee shop and restaurant. Room was clean and spacious. Probably a little pricey but worth the money for the location, friendly staff and nice room - would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, 4 night stay...”
Reviews.Author: ThePakMan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 4-nights, so I should be able to provide a sufficient review. First and foremost, the staff is AWESOME. Very helpful, respectful and accommodating. Although I made no special requests and only utilized room service once, all the employees I came across on a daily basis were very courteous. As everyone else has already touched upon, the rooms are very small. Being a solo traveler, I found that the room was adequate for me but I could not imagine sharing that space with a companion or worse, a family. I was working long hours, all four days and the quality bed/pillows provided sufficient comfort for a good night's rest. The television is a standard LCD; very nice but a lack of HD programming (perhaps Iâ€™m being a tad greedy). Ample desk space to squeeze a laptop and the wireless internet access was very reliable and helpful. Touching upon the size of the room again, the closet was smaller than the one I had in my cramped college dorm room. It was enough space for me, but fitting more bags and clothing in there would be a difficult task. The room safe was handy; the refrigerator and coffeemaker were also great attributes. The bathroom was only large enough for 1 person, so don't expect to share it with a companion if need be. Nice granite countertops and adequate water pressure. An irritating feature was the mirror in the bathroom, which was too low. Nice feature to exam your torso, but how the heck am I supposed to shave, etc? LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION....this place is in a GREAT location. Convenient access to shopping, restaurants and mass transit. Cons: Dirty carpet, hallways were indeed very warm (inadequate ventilation?), food selection was minimal, but satisfactory (delicious steak :), pathetic exercise facilities (maybe I was expecting too much), the pool area smelled over-chlorinated (I didn't swim however), my room toilet was not balanced either. Overall, don't hesitate to stay at the establishment. Yeah, there are a few downfalls but it was a great value and worth the stay. Well done to the GM, who I can see frequently comments on this site. I would surely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Newly refurbished hotel is nice, but rooms are tiny.”
Reviews.Author: organboy
Reviews.Content: This hotel has recently been refurbished and is generally very nice. However, our standard room was very cramped with a view of a dirty block of flats. The location is very good and the concierge was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Watch how you check in !!!”
Reviews.Author: halfacoach
Reviews.Content: My Son in law (to be) along with a friend were stranded in Toronto both being 25, they missed the last train home. he attempted to check into this hotel at 11:50 pm . Their credit cards would not hold enough on them for the deposit, so they offered cash to the night clerk. This was promptly refused. they demanded a credit card to get a room. He then phoned me asking if I could give them my credit card number to get a room, I spoke to the night manager, who told me he could not take the credit card over the phone he needed a copy of the front and back of the card, obviously this was impossible since I was in another city. He then said that he could fax or email me a form or I could go online and reserve a room with my credit card. I asked for the email, he told me that it would be easier if I went online and reserved, I did so immediately. My son in law then phoned to make sure the reservation went through, he was told yes it did but that did not pay for the room, it only reserved the room and he would need a the credit card that was used to pay for the room. Again cash was offered to pay for the room in the morning along with the online credit card holding the room. This was refused again. Another call to Holiday inn from me to sort it out. I asked for the night clerk who refused the room again, to ask why it was refused even though I did exactly as the Night Manager told me to do, he had no answer , and passed me to the night manager again, who told me he was following policy. I asked for an explanation, obviously by this point I was not pleased being given the run around at now 12:30 am and just attempting to get the 2 young men into a room and off the streets. I still was attempting to get an answer from the night manager when I asked for his name and his position, he gave me his name and told me he was the manager of the hotel, I asked again his position and he again said manager. Never mentioning he was night manager till i demanded his position. ( I was attempting to just get these 2 into a room, and hoped I could speak to a general manager) At this point the night manager told me he felt I was rude and he was following policy and would not give them a room. ( at no time was I vulgar or rude-- but definitely loud, as at this point frustration from the run around was wearing thin ) I told him that he was to make a decision on whether he was going to give them a room or put them into the street. He changed his mind and... ACCEPTED CASH AND DEBIT AS A DEPOSIT WITHOUT THE CREDIT CARD AS FIRST WAS OFFERED ! The room was then given to them at 12:45 am --almost an hour of hassles for no reason. I have to ask why ? WHY were these 2 young men put through this? WHY ? was I put through this ? WHY was a verbal credit card number number not accepted over the phone, the same way a phone reservation is taken ? And why would this night manager ever be allowed to put 2 young men out in the street at now 12:45 am ? This is the way I would expect to be treated from a low budget motel, not a world class hotel. So to sum things up BEWARE of how you try to get a room at the Holiday inn, where policy comes before people at all costs, even when that policy means your in the street at 1245 am in downtown Toronto--- NO SOUP FOR YOU!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, an oasis of calm”
Reviews.Author: Frogletsmum
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with my choice. Really friendly and helpful staff.Room good on the whole.Location great for everything that I wanted to see and do. Negatives- wardrobe not easy to access. Room safe on floor of difficult wardrobe( not great for seniors) I had to crawl on the floor to use it. Restaurant lacked ambience, and menu choice. Overall this was a great place for shopping and sightseeing. Plenty of restaurants outside the hotel meant I didn't have to use the restaurant. Pity as there were times when I would have preferred not to go out. Bar menu just a cut down of the restaurant .....it would have been nice to have bar food.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: RAYWATTY
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights prior to a tour of Ontario. Has all that was needed for a short stay and near the main attractions and metro. Room was a bit on the small side but everything was clean and tidy. Decent breakfast as well.

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointing”
Reviews.Author: cookie3_11
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed for 2 nights before travelling onto Niagra Falls then returning a few days later for a one night stay. 1st room was on the 6th floor opposite lifts. Very noisy staff from about 4.30am going about there business. On our return we asked for a higher floor which again was right near the lifts. Therefore noisy. We had booked and paid for hotel through an agent yet on checking out after the 1st 2 nights they tried to charge us again. Then on checking back in on the final leg of our trip we were told no booking could be found! However the reception staff sorted bith issues with no problem. Parking very expensive 2 nights $50. Lots of beggars around the area. Would not have felt comfortable wandering around alone.

Reviews.Title: “Good Staff”
Reviews.Author: DSeanor
Reviews.Content: Our stay was really enjoyable..... the room was a little small but good use was made of the small space and it was extremely clean and also affordable. We found the staff to be helpful, especially Daniel at the front desk, who checked us in. He was very friendly and made sure everything was to our satisfaction. We would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “More than what I expected”
Reviews.Author: apbmore
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Holiday Inn for one night and the room was very nice. The check in process was ok. I had a hard time figuring out the parking garage. There is a stop sign once you enter the garage and the gate doesn't open right away if you don't pull all the way up. It was rather confusing. Once we parked their was about 15 people walking around the garage just to find the exit. My only other complaint is the elevators. We waited for over 7 minutes for one of the 4 elevators. Other than that our stay was great. Decent location, good breakfast, and nice clean rooms!

Reviews.Title: “toronto hotel”
Reviews.Author: paradisesydney
Reviews.Content: First class hotel. Very central. No complaints except it was impossible for anyone to close the room doors quietly. 10% discount for hotel clients given by Golden Griddle across the road.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for your money”
Reviews.Author: northropfrye
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for acceptable basic accommodation in downtown Toronto this is a worthy place to try. The prices are affordable and the hotel is nicely renovated in a very convenient location within walking distance of both the business district and tourist attractions. One issue we had was an 1.5 hour wait to check in due to computer problems. The rooms were clean and modern, but very basic and small. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad!”
Reviews.Author: yankeefangirl526
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in this hotel last Friday night and we didn't experience any problems. Check in was very easy, the room was clean and had great water pressure. We got a good deal on hotwire. It's pretty far north compared to the Rogers Centre but it was only a 5 minute subway ride to the baseball games we went to. We were in a hurry to get to the game upon check-in and I didn't see any signs for the parking lot, so we ended up parking a couple blocks away on Jarvis for $16 instead of the hotel price of $25. We didn't check out the pool or fitness center, but the room wasn't bad at all.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best for the money”
Reviews.Author: Rjdainty1
Reviews.Content: The hotel is certainly clean, but the rooms aren't very good. Small, dark, and very hot despite the near useless air conditioning being on. Bathroom is a good size, with decent shower. Free wifi, but expires every couple of hours then the code must be re-entered. Staff not overly friendly, although theyve certainly not been rude. All in all, for the money I would look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “False alarm ruined the one night”
Reviews.Author: CandNMontreal
Reviews.Content: This Holiday Inn is a veryn acceptable one.I booked two rooms for a Saturday night Sept 10 One was a two double bedder and the other a King. The former was very nice overlooking Carlton but the King was a bit nasty facing a wall, same price. The front entrance has no place to stop and no doorman or porter to direct you. The parking is reasonable $25 tax incl) being a public lot accessible by the elevator. The rooms though smallish were comfortable with nice amenities, including an empty fridge, safe, excellent TV, desk, electrical outlets, shower etc. The pillows were dreadful in spite of being tagged hard and soft- not a feather in any of them, At 3.30 A,M.some doofus set off the fire alarm which ended evertone's sleep forthe night. The announcments were pretty unintelligible. It was caused by some git trying to disable his smoke detector to cover up his smoking. Next morning, no apologies or gestures of amends such as an offer of breaksast or parking or even a discount coupon. Bush! It would have been an opportunity to shine and although the place was fully booked, nothing was offered.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: Donna C
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with two children while we visited the CNE and Ontario Place. The rooms were extremely clean and modern. The choices of pillow softness were a nice touch. The hotel was busy but the rooms were quiet and we heard no noises in the night. This room had the best water pressure! The Tour Advisor in the lobby was very helpful and made sure we understood our subway directions. Check in/out was easy and there were no line ups. We found parking spaces in the underground lot with no problems and were even allowed to remain parked there after checking out until 3pm. Signage for the parking lot could be more visible from Carlton St. We had breakfast in the hotel and there were many things for the kids to eat. They even gave a take out cup of coffee for me. We enjoyed the pool also, it was very clean. The roof top patio was also a nice area. Any staff we met in the elevator said hello and spoke to the kids. Would definitely stay here again and would recommend it to friends. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Families Beware”
Reviews.Author: richrosa
Reviews.Content: This a newly converted and refurbished (fmr. Days Inn) in a central downtown location near almost everything. The hotel is clean, and the staff is friendly. My perspective is from traveling with a family of four (ages 10&12). - The parking lot is tiny and cramped, and is located behnd the hotel with no clear directions. All the drivers in the lot are nervous about space issues as its difficult to park, and to find a spot. It is an unmanned garage although at the excessive $25CDN per day and with the space capability, it should be. - Our double queen bed room was smaller than most single bed setups that you would see in Europe. Literally, there was no room to walk beside the beds. They could not have made the beds or the rooms any smaller. This is very uncomfortable for a family. - There are four elevators. They are always full and slow. Not unusual for an urban hotel, but be prepared to take extra time. - The air conditioning was inconsistent during our stay. It often didn't work making the hotel hot. - I'm a PR Platinum. They have us a welcome bag with an expired freshness stale pretzel bag. The Platinum line is used by everyone. Recognizing that it is an urban downtown hotel makes any family travel challenging, but this one is NOT set up well for it from the start.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, we'll be back.”
Reviews.Author: rejeanandbob
Reviews.Content: The rooms are elegant, not too large but they are adequate. The bathrooms could do with a ceiling fan. Sliding doors were a good idea. Service was exceptional. John and the front desk, Kelly with 'tours' and just about everyone you spoke too. Hotel location was ideal, within walking distance to Eaton Centre, Gay Village and downtown buisinesses.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: DJ_Domninc
Reviews.Content: My stay was great, I checked in late and the desk clerk immediately advised me that he was set up a late check out. The staff was very courteous and responsive and the room was great. I'd definetly stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, good service, would book again”
Reviews.Author: xShernix
Reviews.Content: This is a very clean hotel which has been refurbished recently.. it took me and my other half a long time to deceide on a hotel for Toronto. I'm very fussy when it comes to hotels, they must be very clean, spacious and must offer a good service - this definitely met all my requirements. The sheets, towels were replaced daily along with the room being cleaned daily. It was a very good location, in the centre of Toronto city, everything was walking distance.. in toronto every just jumps onto the trams but we actually walked around most of the city and it was really nice. China town, CN tower, access to the Islands, all within walking distance from Hotel. Lots of food places outside the hotels, breakfast, takeaways, restaurants you name it. Holiday inn downtown made our stay in Toronto very easy and hassle free. The food is a little pricey at the hotel but its ok if you can't be bothered to go out!

Reviews.Title: “Perhaps my expectations were too high...”
Reviews.Author: Jaimck
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an executive king guest room, and I would have to say that I was a little disappoitned because I expected more staying in an executive guest room on a higher floor - I think that was the only thing that set it apart from the other guest rooms. The room was small but very nicely decorated, and clean - loved the glass shower! Also it was very hot, there was no A/C in the hallways/elevator and being that you had long wait times for the elevator and once on you had to stop on nearly every floor in the elevator it made it very uncomfortable and almost felt sick. The parking was full which was very disappointing as I expected to be able to park at the hotel without worry. We had to park in a pay and display lot nearby, leaving our car outside and we had to go back a couple of times to buy another ticket (i.e. wake up at 7am to renew our pay and display). Other than that it was a good stay, and the staff was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Too hot! Would not return”
Reviews.Author: dpenta
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights 8/4 to 8/7. My roommate arrived on an earlier flight and was given a dirty room when he checked in. At check-in and check-out the front desk clerks were indifferent. Overall, the hotel was in a convenient location and nicely remodeled although the room was a bit on the small side. Comfortable beds. However, our chief complaint was that the elevators and interior hallways were about 85 degrees and our room never got much below 75-77. The climate control unit did nothing to cool the room down, no matter what we did. We were both sleeping with the covers off and had to keep the shades drawn during the day to keep the room from getting even hotter.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: angela1440
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here for 2 nights Aug 5 & 6, 2011. It is in an excellent location for shopping, theatre, etc. Nice new contemporary decor, good service at front desk, good shower, nice beds, clean. A few minor things they could improve upon: there is no AC in the lobbies, cleaning staff came around too early, some elevators do not go down to the underground parking, so don't waste time waiting for the wrong elevator, parking is $25 per day (you get in and out priviledges). I found it inconvenient to take the parking pass to the front desk each day to get it validated. But overall, I would definitely stay at this hotel again. It was $150 per night. Very easy to get to after getting off the Don Valley Parkway. Free internet. Small fridge in the room is handy.

Reviews.Title: “Met our expectations”
Reviews.Author: maptreker
Reviews.Content: We were visiting friends in Toronto who live outside of the city. We decided to spend one night in the city and booked a room through Holiday Inn directly. It was a holiday weekend and we felt we got a reasonable rate for the room. We were impressed with the lobby.Very clean and contemporary. Check in went very well and we were upgraded to one of the rooms on the executive floor.The room was spotless,the furnishings were in very good condition and the bed was very comfortable. We did feel the room was a little small for being on the exec.floor but it was only for one night. We didn't use any of the services available as we got in late, had a late check out then we were on the road again. This is great hotel for a quick weekend get away in the heart of Toronto....

Reviews.Title: “They should get their act together”
Reviews.Author: italynchick
Reviews.Content: My husband and I purchased a WagJag voucher and used it for a night stay in July. It seemed pretty normal when we first got there, we signed in got our key, bla, bla, bla...anyway we went upstairs (15th floor) but our key would not open the door so I went downstairs and spoke with the manager, she gave me another key and I went back upstairs. Well, the key worked but when we opened the door there was someone's stuff in the room. To say the least we were SHOCKED! Thank god they were not in the room (could you imagine being in the room and someone just opens the door and you were....., well you know what I mean). My husband was pissed now. We went back down to the lobby and waited to speak to the manager who appologized and gave us another room (on the 20th floor) and compt our parking ($25). We then went up and settled ourselves in our room and then went to lunch. During our lunch I noticed that the name on the card for the compt parking was not our name...OMG! When we went back to the hotel I again waited in line and spoke with the manager. She was confused and angry at the attendant that originally signed us in because now the reservations were all mixed up an it took them 1/2 hour to resolve the situation. That was that?? YYeeaa, NO. We didn't realize that the room we got was right across the hall from the pop/ice room, and ALL night we heard that door SLAMMING! shut - over and over and over again. Needless to say we were jolted out of sleep all night long. IT SUCKED! They should get their act together.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: samgill
Reviews.Content: I stayed at downtown Holiday on the last weekend April 2011. I was there for an exam at princess margaret hospital so the location was great. but the room was crampy and too much noise from the road uptil late hours of night, had to close the window. Breakfast was not included (for a price close to $200/ night) - imagine to go for an exam that is 8 hours (on a sunday morning) long at 7 am and no breakfast! the day before i had requested late checkout and the front desk guy was kind enough to oblige. but when i returned to my hotel after my exam my room card key was disabled. when I approached the front desk the lady told me i will have to pay extra. when i told her that late check out was already discussed the day before, she just left me and attended to someone else, while i waited for another receptionist. it took me about 20 minutes (after about 8 hours of being in the exam center) of waiting to get my room key activated. I checked out soon after that. What really bugged me is the fact that I wrote a letter to the manager of soon after returned home- its been 2-3 months, I am still waiting for his/ her reply. Hopefully they will read this review.

Reviews.Title: “A huge step up from its former existance as a Days Inn”
Reviews.Author: JT88
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights with my husband. We booked a King Suite room on the highest floor that the suites were available (17th or 18th floor). We were pleasantly surprised at how nice it was. Noise was minimal, and room was clean. Bathroom was also clean (of which there were two - one accessible from the bedroom and the other located in the entryway to the separate living room). We were travelling with a large group of guests (scattered around the hotel) and the separate living room suite was perfect as a gathering point for us and our friends. No problems with bed bugs. The free included internet worked fine for us, though Skype audio would drop out during the daytimes. The internet was significantly faster off-hours (ie. in the middle of the night) so we assume it was a matter of bandwith/# of users. Checkin/checkout were problem free, and they were able to accomodate my request to have my husband check-in first (I didn't arrive into Toronto until much later) despite the original booking being under my name. Did not get a chance to try the food, but we did do champagne in the bar and service was friendly (and they were even able to accomodate our request for fresh blueberries in the champagne). Location was fantastic (half a block from Church and the gay village, as were in town for the Toronto Pride festivities). Prices seemed a touch high for a Holiday Inn (given that they were similar to prices at the nearby Sutton Hotel, and the Intercontinental Hotel). HUGE step up from its former existence as a Days Inn Hotel (that hotel was old, dirty and the rooms I've stayed in there were smelly and musty). We would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Honest Review of Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: JoeRollin
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of spending two nights at this hotel, the rooms are small but nicely laid out very clean, king size bed, fridge in the room, 32 flat screen television the staff there was very helpfull, the hotel is close to a lot of good shopping mainly the Eaton"s Centre, the only real problem I had was trying to find the underground parking facility an of course the day I went there was construction on the street leading to the parking garage which made it more difficult to get into also two I found out that being a guest at the hotel you have to pay for parking a Little over $30 a night Other than that the hotel was a good experience The question would I go back? yes

Reviews.Title: “Thought it was great”
Reviews.Author: BillyWhizz0
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Holiday Inn three nights at the beginning and two nights at the end of holidays. We all found the Hotel rooms spotless and well equipped,all the staff were very helpful and informative. The location may not be to everyones liking but we thoroughly enjoyed our visit and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The old Days Inn on Carlton”
Reviews.Author: stevefranco2219
Reviews.Content: I stayed at 4 hotels in Toronto over a one month period. 2 were great for the price, 1 was ok and this one not so good. This was sort of my mistake, as I had thought from the hotel name this was the place in the Entertainment district on King Street, but that's now a Hyatt. This place in on Carlton next to the old Maple Leaf Gardens, it used to be the Days Inn. Part of the reason I was pretty sure it was the one on King Street was the price was pretty high. Wasn't all that happy when I figured it out. Anyway, it's not that different. Partied there once after a Leaf game many years ago and the rooms are still as small as I remember. Bed wasn't all that comfy either, I could feel the springs, didn't sleep all that well. When I mentioned it to the front desk girl she kind of mulbuled something but never really offered to fix it (I thought maybe I could get a different room for the 2nd night. Didn't happen.) Wake up calls didn't work either. Annoying. TV was fuzzy, maintenance guy never showed up to fix it and the internet was awful, could barely google directions. The staff was just not friendly at all, especially after I made mention to the maid that it would be nice if she cleaned the bathroom vent that was stuffed with dust - she didn't like me very much. LOL! Maybe for 1/2 the price I paid it would be ok for a quick no frills over night. It's a decent location to get around downtown for sure.

Reviews.Title: “convenient location but small”
Reviews.Author: hotelbum
Reviews.Content: My sister and I chose this hotel because it's in the heart of downtown and is close to subway stations and shops. The hotel is very close to Yonge Street..the hubbub of the city.The lobby is good size, business center has 3 computers and is always accessible. We had a 2 queen nonsmoking room. The space between the end of the bed to the desk/dresser is only wide enough for one person to walk at a time. We were on the 18th floor so the view is of the city which meant high rises and rooftops. It was very quiet though. The overall amenities were ok with toiletries, coffee maker and fridge...no microwave though. I wish they provided one. In general we were happy with our stay. I just have one question for the hotel...is there a ramp for the entrance anywhere? We had to drag our luggage up the stairs even though there were perhaps 6 to 7 steps. How do guests who have wheelchairs and guests with lots of luggage handle it?

Reviews.Title: “Reno really payed off”
Reviews.Author: Scrumble
Reviews.Content: Reno makes this place feel like a modern upscale hotel. Rooms were small but nicely furnished with a stocked bathroom including bath and body works products. Includes a big empty fridge great for self stocking from the lcbo down the street. Great location walking distance from yonge/dundas, queen st, and the eaton centre. Buffet breakfast was good and included many hot items including waffles. The front desk gave us a code to connect to the wireless network for free. There is a pool and fitness centre which I did not visit. Underground parking connected to the hotel costs $25 for overnight come and go as you please. Caesars spa was on site and the rmt massage was very good. There is also a bar and a gift shop in the hotel. The tour desk and bell desk are happy to help you with directions and recommendations. No complaints here!

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Toronto_Maverick
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in July 11. The good: location, location, location. Itâ€™ll take you literally 2 minutes to subway station. Clean lobby and new rooms.
