Took hospitality 2 minutes to fix my broken shower head. The bad: smallest rooms Iâ€™ve ever stayed in my life (even smaller than a $20/night motel 6 in Death Valley, NV). Dingy corridors and super expensive parking. Expensive restaurants downstairs ($8.50 for a 14 OZ domestic beer). The ugly: pool and gym area. Gym was hot and the â€œkeep the doors closedâ€� sign AT AL TIME did not help the situation. Pool was dirty, filled with hair and no towel on-site. Interestingly enough upon my check-out I complained about it and the receptionist had absolutely no reaction to my complaint. Overall an average hotel in downtown Toronto if you MUST stay in downtown core.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Rochesterian_Guy
Reviews.Content: I am stunned by a couple of the negative reviews. I stayed there July 9 and the place was delightful. The room while small was very nicely refurbished. Bathroom was great. Location is terrific. Front desk staff very nice. Parking is a little pricey, but then again so is parking everywhere in Toronto. You can't go wrong with this place--supposedly they spent $20M on the interior--it shows.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for Pride!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Rusty1414
Reviews.Content: I read some reviews and was shocked at how misleading they are. First of all, the bellman (and trust me I talked to all the boys) were attentive and very sweet. I saw one walking with his girlfriend (supporting pride = pro gay). He even gave me directions and walked me back to the hotel when he realized I was lost, and this is while he was off duty. So if you are going there and are dealing with a smiling curly haired beauty make sure to deal with him and he will treat you like gold. I had no issues with the front desk, everyone treated me with the upmost respect. The only real downside was that the pool was not functioning and the hallway was warm, but that is trivial when faced with the best customer service I've been treated to.

Reviews.Title: “Rude, Homophobic”
Reviews.Author: WilliamPuller
Reviews.Content: My Partner and I book in here for the Pride weekend and We couldnt believe the way we where treated. It only took my partner and I at least 2 minutes to figure out that the staff at this hotel had a problem with us being there. After watching the doorman open the door for others, but walking away and "finding other things to do" as we approached it I decided that the staff at reception were idiots. This action by the doorman happened on more than 2 occasions. Thank god it was automatic or we would have been struggling to get through the doors with our baggage. I think the biggest problem for them was the fact that we are a same sex couple. Big deal! It was the biggest pride weekend in north america. The room was small but ok and the food wasn't great. But I have had better. The staff need to get their heads out of their bottoms and learn some hospitality. STAFF OF THE HOLIDAY INN if you are going to work in this industry, you have to accept the fact that it's a very diverse world and everyone has the right to be happy in it, and you need to give people the respect that they give you. On leaving, we had been waiting at the counter with our bags to check out while the girl at the desk was on the phone, the same girl who had seen us coming and going througout our stay and ignored us on every occaision. After she had finished on the phone she asked us what we wanted!!! hahaha....how lovely. We were so very obviously waiting to check out. What a sad attitude. I can only hope that she had some horrible demanding guests after we left. We were always polite to the staff and never gave them any attitude, it's not in our nature and why should we stoop to their level? We did leave a tip for the woman who looked after our room so nicely. I just hope that she actually got it. Although I will be making several trips to Toronto in the future, I will never stay at that hotel again. I would like all Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual, Transsexual, Transgender, Intersex, Queer/Questioning, 2 Spirited, Allies avoid this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Shocking - Utter Disaster!!”
Reviews.Author: Anony123Anon
Reviews.Content: It was not like we were staying in Room 13 but this was the most awful hotel experience I've come across and I'm an adamant traveler. After paying a considerable amount for standard room accommodation on a busy Canada Day weekend we were disgusted with what service was provided. In a hotel where the hallways had a musty odor we walked into a tiny two bedroom (double-bed room) where we could barely put two suitcases which we as travelers like to live out of. The air conditioning did not work and if anything the room temperature increased over night while we were sleeping - it was better to leave the window open!! Upon heat exhaustion (we stayed over the summer period) NO cups were supplied and we were drinking water out of our hands for the first initial nights! We had just come from America and were traveling onwards to Europe so we had quite a bit of cash on us but NO SAFE to store our valuables. Mind you, the bathroom was the best feature of the room which was well furnished but with minimal toilet paper usage the toilet of course got blocked. Mind you there was a fire incident where we were evacuated onto the street and the lifts were inoperable for an hour or so. We complained to reception and yes the toilet was unblocked and cups were provided but we were left waiting for a safe which never came and the air conditioning's primarily purpose remained and merely contributed to additional greenhouse gases. No room upgrade could be provided other than a room up-size which however involved minus one bed (we would have to share)...btw Blackberry users - wifi service is not supported. Would never stay here again and advise people not to!! Maybe try Bloor St. if you like the 'Holiday Inn' chain.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Fantastic Hotel More like f "ANT" tastic”
Reviews.Author: 154995John
Reviews.Content: My co-workers & I chose to room at the Holiday Inn Downtown Toronto in Toronto, based on prior experence at other Holidays Inn, where we have always been pleased, but this particular Holiday Inn REALLY was Terrible. We rented 3 rooms on the 6th floor. One room was clean and fairly nice. Several of the rooms had a horrible odor that we believe was something from the garden outside the windows. one room had resident insect populations (ants & Flies). I opened the fridge door in the closet of my room and saw LOTS of dead flies. There was ants on one of the bed. The rooms were too cold. The breakfast was bad, you could have smashed a window with the scrammbled eggs, the staff seems scared to look at you, never mind talk to you. The drapes in one room flew off the track when I closed the drapes. And while a sign proclaims "Free wireless internet in all rooms!" the wireless signal is so weak that only a few rooms next to the elevators can use the wireless. Those of us with rooms further from the elevators had to walk to the elevators waiting area to check & recieve e-mail. I will never lodge at this hotel again, and I strongly suggest that others avoid it.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel - good location”
Reviews.Author: cphyde
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights on business. I chose this hotel because it was a good price and only a short taxi ride from downtown where I had meetings. (And there's a subway station about 100 yards away, which would also have taken me there). Can't really fault this Holiday Inn. Excellent decor. Newly refurbished. Bed very comfortable. Room small by north American standards, but OK for one person. Just a shower; but that is all I would use anyway. Very good chair for working at. Air conditioning worked fine - touched mid 90s while I wass there. I ate once in the bar: which was fine. Not cheap, but not bad. Food was good. I didn't use the restaurant. Did have breakfast in the coffee bar - twice - which was also fine; overlooking the street at the front. There is an indoor pool. Very clean and new. I used the fitness equipment, which all worked (which you can't always say). Parking is via the street that runs along the back of the hotel - you have to pay. If you like very expensive shopping, Yorkville is a few blocks north. Plenty of good restaurants in the area. Overall: very pleased. In fact, so pleased I have booked the hotel again this summer when I am back with the family for a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and would return!”
Reviews.Author: KMarriner
Reviews.Content: Great central location, rooms just rennovated and nicely done. Very small rooms and no bathtub (just a shower). Pool was nice and area was clean. Parking is available behind the building. It's a little expensive, but I guess that's standard for downtown. Reception wasn't clear on where it was and on getting a pass, so it was a little annoying as we drove into a city lot first and had to go back and move.

Reviews.Title: “nicely renovated”
Reviews.Author: traveller12360
Reviews.Content: i think this used to be a days hotel---now holiday Inn --great renovations -still small rooms but fine for downtown scene- excellent location for all downtown attractions- great beds, pillows, very clean

Reviews.Title: “Immaculate and eficient”
Reviews.Author: GandC_UK
Reviews.Content: Although there was a mix-up with the days that we were booked the staff sorted it out in an efficient and friendly way. The wholeplace is immaculate and has a very new feeling. Thanks also to the concierge who organised transport for us. One comment is that there could be a bit more supervision of the pool area as we had to leave it early due to children being allowed to continuously jump into the water by their parents. We also struggled to keep the room temperature down as the AC seemed a bit feeble. This was an ideal location afterr we arrived from Heathrow to soend a few days in Toronto before heading onwards to Niagara and then Quebec.

Reviews.Title: “Great beginning to a new hotel”
Reviews.Author: mississaugahunni
Reviews.Content: Stayed here within days after the opening and everything was organized and first class. The renovated rooms were immaculate, comforatble and have all the amenities for either the business or casual traveller. Great location with access to all Toronto sites. The staff was very energetic and willing to help!! Thanks again.

Reviews.Title: “WoW....Pleasantly Surprised!!”
Reviews.Author: smarttraveller2
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the "new" Holiday Inn on Carlton in Toronto simply because I stayed there when it was the "old"Days inn and found it to be a convenient location. WOW....what a nice surprise!! This is not your typical standard Holiday Inn. Rooms were very clean, decorated nicely, and had comfy beds which gave you a choice between firm or soft pillows! Staff members were extremely friendly, and polite. Makes for a nice experience when you are greeted with a warm, friendly smile! The restaurant "the Carlton" is not your typical Holiday Inn restaurant. Food was wonderful, but dessert was fantastic! I would go back just to eat at the restaurant (never thought I would say that about a Holiday Inn restaurant!) People who live in the area are lucky to have this restaurant right at their doorsteps! I am still shocked that this hotel is a Holiday Inn. We will definately return. Price is well worth the stay and wonderful service.

Reviews.Title: “Oddities and quirks”
Reviews.Author: quof
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed for 2 nights. The pluses - the hotel was conveniently located for public transit, my room was available when I arrived well before check-in time, and the staff were friendly. The internet connection was fine. On the downside, my room was apparently in a light shaft with only a small window with minimal light and the layout was nonsensical. In one corner was a small closet with sliding doors; the doors opened less than a foot, so that the back two-thirds of the closet couldn't be accessed, including the safe, yet the doors also would not stay closed. At a right angle to the closet was another closet containing a small fridge on top of a cabinet of drawers, however, because of the location of the closet door, the drawers would only open a couple of inches. Surely some one noticed this in the redesign of the hotel? One day I left early in the morning and returned after 5:00 pm to see that a housekeeper had made the bed, gathered the wastebaskets up in the middle of the room and gathered up the used towels in the middle of the floor, then left. It was clearly past regular housekeeping hours, and they weren't coming back. I called the front desk, and two different employees came to tell me that I must have misunderstood, and offering a number of excuses for why the cleaner simply didn't do her job, but eventually the room got cleaned. Then there was the fire alarm early in the morning...... It will take a great price to entice me back.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding New Addition to the Holiday Inn Family”
Reviews.Author: BritTraveller68
Reviews.Content: This hotel's current position in the ranking is only due to the fact that it only opened a few weeks ago. It rightly deserves to enter the top quartile as quickly as possible. This is one of the best Holiday Inns I've stayed at and as a current Priority Club Platinum member in my tenth anniversary year, I have stayed at many of their properties, so feel well positioned to judge. All the staff were most welcoming and personable. From the front desk team to the restaurant staff, the maintenance crew to housekeeping personnel, you were made to feel very welcome and valued. Twice I ate breakfast with a view of the reception area. Most guests I saw left the reception area with smiles on their faces. The restaurant is worth mentioning. If you're familiar with the North American Holiday Inn brand, this hotel breaks the mould. The restaurant decor is modern and of a much higher quality. The breakfast menu is the same as you would see in US properties, with one or two Canadian additions. The buffet option at CAD17 is very good value and you can eat well from the a la carte menu for around CAD5 more. The buffet selection is very good and all the food was well presented and served piping hot. All the restaurant staff deliver a high level of service. While waiting for my breakfast to arrive on one day, I was offered a newspaper to read and on my fourth morning, I was greeted by a handshake from one waiter. Do eat dinner at least once in the hotel. Forget what you may recall about dinner in other Holiday Inns. The menu is unique to this property, with an excellent chef and a menu that will surprise you with it originality. The food was well presented. One night another guest expressed a wish to have a fish dish, but didn't see anything she liked. The waitress went off and spoke to the chef, who proposed an alternative using many ingredients that weren't on the menu that night. When this arrived, it looked just a good as the dishes that were on the menu that day and was well received. The room I stayed in was very comfortable. I received my Platinum upgrade to a king-size room. My room had one of the bathrooms that just have a large walk-in shower, rather than a bathtub. The water was nice and hot and the pressure strong. The mirror was well lit and there were plenty of new white fluffy towels. There is plenty of desk space in the room and - a first for me in a hotel - a blue recycling box alongside the regular trash can. And the large flat screen TV offered a wealth of channels and other online services. My room was also equipped with a small fridge too. Drinks from the vending machines on the guest floor were just CAD2.25 each. If you need a printer, the business centre, off the very large lobby area, allows you to print a number of complimentary sheets, before a nominal charge kicks in. The hotel is just a few steps from the College/Yonge underground station/street car interchange, so if you don't feel like walking in this very walkable city, you can get to most places very easily. If you take the not-so-express bus from the airport, take this to the Delta Chelsea Hotel stop, which is just a couple of blocks away from the Holiday Inn. To balance my very positive review, there a couple of issues that the new management should address quickly. Firstly, the free high speed Internet service was quite unstable. A few times each day, I would be thrown off and would need to log back in. One night the entire service stopped, confirmed to me as a server crash by the service provider's helpdesk. When it worked, the speeds were acceptable but it was difficult to rely on consistently. Secondly, there was a trend to be disturbed every night by night personnel using their walkie talkies on their hallway patrols and housekeeping staff entering the housekeeping storage rooms, which were opposite the guest rooms on each floor. These interruptions would usually start around 1am and continue to around 3am. The hotel management can easily address this by reminding these staff members that guests are sleeping in the nearby rooms and to avoid talking in the corridors and letting doors slam behind them. Overall though, this is an outstanding new addition to the Holiday Inn family.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: schnugchi
Reviews.Content: There is something in a name and the Holiday Inn is a hotel that I could rely on for good value and a decent stay. Our room was very clean and inviting. There was a choice of pillows for those that prefer soft and/or firm. The room was rather small but it was not a hindrance to our comfort. The location is smack in the middle of downtown Toronto and the subway is a three minute walk away. Early spring is a good time to travel and we got a great deal for our stay -- money well spent.

Reviews.Title: “Simply OK - there's better to be had, though.”
Reviews.Author: IaOrana_Maruuruu
Reviews.Content: I stay at quite a few hotels over the course of the year. I look for a range of rooms - but they always have to be clean, comfortable, inviting, and provide value for money. Value for money can mean spending $550 on a south beach hotel that looks over the ocean, or it can mean a $99 airport hotel, or it can mean $150 on an Orlando Staybridge Suites that is short on frills but long on comforts. In this case, I was attracted to the location - it's close to Church and Wellesley and it operates under a banner name I trust - I am a dedicated Priority Club member. Checked into this hotel recently - had stayed at its predecessor which was a dump. There is no doubt that the hotel has cleaned up its act under the HI name. It has a fantastic location if you are downtown Toronto. Right out the door is the entrance to the subway. Movie theatre a couple of doors down. But after this experience, I would pay another $20 to stay at the Delta, just a few blocks away, knowing I would get a better experience. But the hotel does not have suites yet open, contrary to what was written by another reviewer. At least, that's what we were told on check-in when we specifically asked. I am a Platinum member, meaning I have jumped through to their penultimate level of loyalty card holders, so if they said there were no suites, I'll take their word for it. We stayed in an executive room. It had a washroom, a bed, a closet, a fridge (in a closet), and a tiny window. New furniture, new carpeting, new paint job. Shower was always luke warm, never got hot. Free wi-fi and in room internet. I was assured this was one of the best rooms in the hotel. Not sure how it was executive. Repeat problems with the electronic card key. Repeat problems trying to get out of the downstairs parking lot (the ticket didn't validate on either occasion). Most importantly, this was a hotel ROOM that I didn't want to stay in. It just lacked that warm vibe that I look for. Nice to have the impetus to get out, I suppose, but I prefer a place where I actually WANT to relax after my day. Definitely not this room and if this was one of their best rooms then I wouldn't want to get anything less. Check out staff was very friendly. Check-in staff was average.
